required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Promoting Self-Regulation Skills and Healthy Eating Habits in Early Head Start
clinical_study.official_title: Promoting Self-Regulation Skills and Healthy Eating Habits in Early Head Start

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the effectiveness of a new curriculum on toddlers' self-regulation skills and healthy eating habits. The curriculum is being delivered as part of Early Head Start home visits and compared to the effectiveness of usual practice Early Head Start home visits.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Families are blocked within home visitor caseload and randomly assigned to receive the new curriculum or usual practice Early Head Start home visits for 12 weeks.
study_design_info.masking_description: All interviews are conducted by research assistants who are blind to study condition.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's healthy eating habits: Body mass index
primary_outcome.description: Healthy eating habits will be assessed through change in body mass index

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's healthy eating habits: Food diaries
primary_outcome.description: Healthy eating habits will be assessed through change in consumption of fruits/vegetables and junk food, as assessed with 24-hour food diaries

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's healthy eating habits: Parent reports
primary_outcome.description: Healthy eating habits will be assessed through parent survey of pickiness, etc.; mean scores reported from 5-point Likert scales with higher scores indicating healthier eating habits

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's self-control skills: Direct testing
primary_outcome.description: Children's self-control skills will be assessed through direct testing (e.g., snack delay task)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's self-control skills: Video interactions
primary_outcome.description: Children's self-control skills will be assessed through parent-child interactions, rated on Likert scale from video recordings; mean score reported between 1 = almost never and 5 = almost always

primary_outcome.measure: Change in children's self-control skills: Parent ratings
primary_outcome.description: Children's self-control skills will be assessed through parent ratings on standardized behavior checklists; mean scores reported from 3- or 5-point Likert scales with higher scores indicating greater self-control

primary_outcome.measure: Change in parents' sensitive/responsiveness: Video interactions
primary_outcome.description: Parents' sensitive/responsiveness will be assessed through parent-child interactions, rated on Likert scale from video recordings; mean score reported between 1 = almost never and 5 = almost always

primary_outcome.measure: Change in parents' sensitive/responsiveness: Parent ratings
primary_outcome.description: Parents' sensitive/responsiveness will be assessed through parent ratings on standardized surveys; mean scores reported from 5-point Likert scales with higher scores indicating greater sensitive/responsiveness

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in children's sleep habits: Parent reports
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep habits will be assessed through parent survey; mean scores reported from 5-point Likert scales with higher scores indicating better sleep habits

arm_group.description: For 12 weeks, home visitors will stop delivering the usual practice Early Head Start home visits and deliver the Recipe 4 Success curriculum instead. At the end of 12 weeks, home visitors will resume usual practice Early Head Start home visits.
Home visitors will continue to deliver usual practice Early Head Start home visits that follow a standard curriculum and are tailored on an ongoing basis to meet individual family needs.

intervention.description: Home visitors teach parents about children's self-regulation skills and healthy eating habits. The home visitors then teach parents how to sensitively scaffold the development of their toddlers' self-regulation skills in the context of cooking and snack preparation lessons. Prior research shows that self-regulation skills in early childhood predict long-term health indicators, such as BMI. Prior research also shows that children who are involved in the preparation of healthier foods are more likely to eat them.
Home visitors will continue to deliver usual practice Early Head Start home visits that follow a standard curriculum and are tailored on an ongoing basis to meet individual family needs.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children must be receiving Early Head Start home visits and be at least 2 years old at the beginning of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
-
